text: python function slowing down for no apparent reason
I have a python function defined as follows which i use to delete from list1 the items which are already in list2.
I am using python 2.6.2 on windows XP

code:
def compareLists(list1, list2):
    curIndex = 0
    while curIndex < len(list1):
        if list1[curIndex] in list2:
            list1.pop(curIndex)
        else:
            curIndex += 1

text: Here, list1 and list2 are a list of lists

code:
list1 = [ ['a', 11221, '2232'], ['b', 1321, '22342'] .. ]

# list2 has a similar format.

text: I tried this function with list1 with 38,000 elements and list2 with 150,000 elements.
If i put in a print statement to print the current iteration, I find that the function slows down with each iterations.
At first, it processes around 1000 or more items in a second and then after a while it reduces to around 20-50 a second.
EDIT: In the case with my data, the curIndex remains 0 or very close to 0 so the pop operation on list1 is almost always on the first item.
If possible, can someone also suggest a better way of doing the same thing in a different way?
